name: SCOTCH GAME
idea: White immediately opens the center with d4, avoiding the long theoretical lines of the Ruy Lopez. After 3...exd4 4.Nxd4, the Knight is beautifully centralized and White has rapid development. The idea is to get open positions with active piece play. This is an honest and direct opening, very popular with players who want concrete play.
errors_white: Nxc6 bxc6 without reason: doubles the pawns but gives Black the center and the b-file
Bc4 too early in certain lines: allows ...Nxe4! winning a pawn
Neglecting development to attack: premature attack without developed pieces fails
errors_black: Premature ...Qh4?!: after Nc3! the Queen is exposed and White develops with tempo
...Bc5 without ...Nf6: the Bishop can be attacked by c3-d4 or Nb3
Letting the Nd4 dominate: you must contest it with ...Nf6 or chase it with ...c5
development: Already centralized! Can go to f5, b5 or stay dominant in the center
Develop to e3 (supports d4) or c4 (targets f7) depending on the variation
Go to c3 to control d5 and support e4
Quick kingside castle, or sometimes 0-0-0 in aggressive lines
Centralize on d1 and e1 to control the open files

traps.name: Queen Trap
traps.desc: After 4...Qh4?! 5.Nc3! (not g3?? Qxe4+) White threatens Ndb5 and Nd5. The Queen is misplaced and must flee. AVOID (Black): Don't bring out the Queen so early! Play ...Nf6 or ...Bc5.

traps.name: Scotch Gambit
traps.desc: 4.Bc4!? (instead of Nxd4) sacrifices a pawn for development. After ...Bc5?! 5.c3! White recovers d4 with initiative. AVOID (Black): Play ...Nf6! attacking e4, or ...d6 solid.

traps.name: Knight Trap
traps.desc: After 4...Nf6 5.Nxc6?! bxc6 Black has an excellent center with ...d5! and the b-file to attack. AVOID (White): Keep the Nd4 or play Nc3 first.

variants.name: Classical
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 d2d4 e5d4 f3d4 f8c5 c1e3 d8f6
variants.white_plan: c3 to secure the Nd4, then Nc3 and Qd2. Long castle (0-0-0) is possible for a kingside attack.
variants.black_plan: ...Qf6 attacks d4 and prepares ...Nge7-g6. Black aims for ...d5 to free and equalize.

variants.name: Scotch Gambit
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 d2d4 e5d4 f1c4 g8f6 e4e5
variants.white_plan: Sacrifice the d4 pawn for ultra-rapid development. e5 chases the Nf6 and opens attack lines on f7.
variants.black_plan: Retreat ...d5! blocks the Bc4 and returns the pawn. After exf6 dxc4, Black has good play.

variants.name: Mieses Variation
variants.uci: e2e4 e7e5 g1f3 b8c6 d2d4 e5d4 f3d4 g8f6 d4c6 b7c6
variants.white_plan: The doubled c6 pawns are a long-term weakness. Develop Bd3, 0-0, then queenside pressure.
variants.black_plan: The doubled pawns give control of d5! Play ...d5 quickly to activate pieces and open the game.
